intro: Schmidelia javensis, commonly known as the Java schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and is often found in tropical rainforests. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to the bark of trees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
